docs.title: 👋 Welcome to Nitesh Notes
docs.text: A curated collection of technical knowledge covering system design, microservices, Java & Spring Boot, WebFlux, and distributed systems. This space is my personal engineering knowledge base — continuously evolving as I learn, build, and grow.

docs.title: 📘 System Design
docs.text:
Deep dives into distributed systems, scalability, fault tolerance, databases, caching, load balancing, microservices architecture, patterns, failures, and real-world trade-offs.

Explore topics like:

  • Load Balancers
  • API Gateways
  • Saga vs 2PC
  • Event-Driven Systems
  • Sharding & Partitioning
  • Consistency Models
  • Message Brokers

Use these notes for interviews, architectural decisions, and high-level design discussions.

docs.title: 🌱 Spring / Java Engineering
docs.text:
Practical notes, patterns, and best practices around:

  • Spring Boot
  • Spring WebFlux (reactive)
  • Filters, Interceptors, AOP
  • Exception Handling
  • Configuration Management
  • Microservices Architecture with Spring
  • Clean code and SOLID practices

Guided by production-grade standards.

docs.title: ⚡ High-Performance Systems
docs.text:
Notes on:

  • Concurrency
  • Reactive programming
  • Backpressure
  • Threading models
  • JVM tuning
  • Low-latency design choices

Great for backend engineers optimising throughput, scalability, or responsiveness.

docs.title: 💡 LeetCode & DSA Notes
docs.text:
Concise explanations for tricky problems, including approaches, optimal solutions, and complexity analysis.

Ideal for:

  • Interview preparation
  • Pattern-based learning
  • Building algorithmic intuition

docs.title: 📚 Knowledge Hub Overview
docs.text:
How this site is structured

All topics are organised into focused sections. Each page is designed to be self-contained and easy to reference, with diagrams, examples, and intuitive navigation.

Navigation Highlights - Left sidebar → browse categories - Top search bar → quickly find any note - Breadcrumb trail → track where you are

docs.title: 🛠️ Tools & Methods Used
docs.text:
Technologies Behind the Notes

  • Markdown for all content
  • MkDocs with Material theme
  • Mermaid for diagrams
  • GitHub Pages for deployment
  • Git versioning for history and evolution

This ensures fast, reliable access to all notes both locally and online.

docs.title: 🧩 Why I Built This
docs.text:
Software engineering is a constant journey. Having a personal, organized, and always-deployable knowledge base means:

  • Faster recall of concepts
  • Cleaner interview preparation
  • Centralized learning
  • Zero dependency on external note-taking apps
  • Markdown-first → easy to maintain long term

This site grows as I grow.

docs.title: ✨ Stay Tuned
docs.text: More notes will be added — from system design case studies to deep-dive engineering guides, architectural patterns, and hands-on Spring Boot/WebFlux code walkthroughs.

docs.title: 🙌 Thanks for visiting!
docs.text: If you find something insightful or want to explore deeper topics, feel free to navigate using the sidebar or search bar above.
